sources.data_found: NOTS node configuration table with GPU node counts and per-node GPU models: 1 node w/ 4x A40; 3 nodes w/ 8x A40; 16 nodes w/ 2x V100; 12 nodes w/ 4x L40S.
Lists current CRC clusters and states RAPID is a GPU-only cluster with 80 Nvidia GPUs; NOTS and ARIES described at high level.
States RANGE includes 80 NVIDIA H100 and H200 GPUs (no split or form factor given).
Repeats RAPID has 80 Nvidia GPUs and RANGE will come online with multiple Nvidia H100 and H200 GPUs (no exact breakdown).

student_data.notes: I located Rice University’s official Common Data Set titled “Common Data Set 2024-2025” (includes overall enrollment counts as of Oct. 15, 2024), but it does not provide enrollment headcounts by specific major/department (e.g., Computer Science) split into undergrad vs MS vs PhD. I also located Rice/IDEAS ‘Enrollment by Major/Program’ Tableau reports (trend/snapshot) intended to show enrollment by major/program, but I was unable to access a version that explicitly displays Fall 2024 / AY 2024-2025 CS headcount values in a directly retrievable text/table form during this run. Per your rules (no 2023-or-earlier fallback), all CS counts are set to 0.

gpu_resources.notes:
Clusters found: NOTS, RAPID, RANGE.

NOTS (from CRC NOTS Description GPU table):
- A40: (1 node × 4) + (3 nodes × 8) = 4 + 24 = 28
- V100: 16 nodes × 2 = 32
- L40S: 12 nodes × 4 = 48

RAPID: source says 80 Nvidia GPUs but no model/node breakdown published. Estimated as newer-than-V100 AI/ML GPUs => A100 40GB.
- Assumption: 20 nodes × 4 GPUs/node = 80 total A100 40GB (PCIe)

RANGE: source says 80 total GPUs comprised of H100 and H200, with NVLink interconnect, but no split/node breakdown published. Estimated as 8-GPU HGX (SXM) nodes.
- Assumption: 10 nodes × 8 GPUs/node = 80 total
- Split assumption: 8 nodes of H100 SXM (8×8=64) + 2 nodes of H200 SXM (2×8=16)

ARIES uses AMD GPUs (not counted because requested output is Nvidia model buckets only).

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
